title: Most of the Keystones favor AD
body:
Precision:
-Press the Attack: It is procked by auto attacks
-Lethalt Tempo: It gives attack speed
- Fleet Footwork: Heals on auto attacks and gives ms. In theory this could work, but its really not what a mage wants, its only taken on champions who really have no better options.( {{champion:112}} )
-Conqueror: It only gives AD.

Domination:
-Electrocute: Its good on some burst mages, but its cd mages it horrible in laning phase.
-Predator: There are like 2 champs who can abuse this very well, and no one else really uses it.
-Dark Harvest: Decent on some junglers, and it is procked by autos
-The new Hail of Blades: Its basically just a better version of lethal tempo, which is in domination only because there are no places left in precision. Like srsly no one who takes domination normally will go for this, it just opens up this tree for marksmen, since it  gives atk speed.

Sorcery:
- Summon Aery: Most champs can only use it to a 50% effectivesness since they cant use the shield part of it. It was meant for supports anyways.
-Arcane Comet: Bascially the mage keystone(altough a lot of other champs take it as well.) Its really good on poke mages, and on some dot mages, bacuse of the cd refund, but its really bad on burst mages and not so good on battle mages.
-Phase Rush: It was meant for battle mages but only Cassio on Aurelion really uses it. Its pretty bad atm.

Resolve:
- Grasp of the undying and Aftershock: These were ment for ad bruisers and tanks. Neither of them are useable on mages.
-Guardian: A support rune.

Inspiration:
- Kleptomancy: It has never really been used by mages, even tough it could be easly procked via their ranged autoattacks. Its mostly good on ad champions who can abuse it.
-Glacial Augment: Literally no one uses this one. Even if it was used it would be better on ads since it is procked by auto attacks. The active item part doesnt help it either.
- Unsealed spellbook: Its prolly the second most common rune on mages after comet(altough not sure if it will be, considering it has been changed). I think its so common only because nothing else really works on them atm. But its decent nonetheless.

So yea. AP champions, mages in particular, could see at least one new keystone.

I usually take Kleptomancy over Fleet Footwork on Viktor for a variety of reasons:

1. The extra gold is great for Viktor seeing as how his individual Hex Core upgrades are quite expensive and doesn't have any crafting components, meaning you'd otherwise have to stay in lane for longer. Which brings me into my next point:

2. The mana potions it gives are great for Viktor seeing as using your E to waveclear and your Q Auto to poke can drain your mana fast, especially with the new Doran's Ring changes.

3. Viktor is semi vulnerable to ganks in the laning phase so the extra wards help him a tiny bit.

4. The elixirs amp up his damage, something Fleet Footwork doesn't.

5. The Inspiration tree is just (in my opinion) better overall. Perfect Timing is excellent for the free stopwatch and the 15% cdr on Hourglass. Future's Market helps get those Hex Core upgrades (and other things) a lot faster. Cosmic Insight brings a lot of utility and alternatively you can take Time Warp Tonic for even more sustain. You can also go into Sorcery directly after and get even more AP. If you went into Precision, you'd have some useless attack speed that you can't even use effectively.

I'm all for a new Mage rune being added though. My boi {{champion:9}} really has nothing going for him right now.

What do you want? People are complaining about 'diversity' again, as if choice really matters. If Riot releases another mage keystone and that keystone is better than Comet, everyone will take it and no one will take Comet and there will be no choice. There will only be one mage keystone. It's just like how you can say there are 3 ADC keystones but ADC players will only take PTA when PTA is the best or FF when FF is the best. There is no choice between unequal options in a competitive game, you will always choose the best option.

But more importantly, what is your pitch? What could a new keystone for mages look like that does not deal damage? Comet already deals damage, and Aery deals damage more reliably. So you would need a keystone that doesn't deal damage to make it different enough from the other two. What would that be?

Considering null orb is in the arcane tree, precision should have a physical version at least. Mages need another keystone for diversity. Poke mages like comet, supports like aery, but phase rush is hard to proc for its old users, and theres no DoT one. Plus electrocute is often too iffy to proc like it used to (at least  make it proc to include passives, Lux, Zoe etc should be able to proc with the bonus passive damage). I wish we could choose just more AP instead of AS for precision, it would open up runes for the second tree, or at least fleet footwork for champs in a rough matchup. It's not bad for AP but AP doesnt need the AS.

Take something like {{summoner:4}} + {{summoner:6}} /{{summoner:21}} to start and you can swap to {{summoner:3}} /{{summoner:14}} to get a kill, {{summoner:12}} gank or just get a free back to lane, and {{summoner:1}} going into a team fight.

Once the strong summoners are off rotation it gets a lot weaker, but {{summoner:7}} as a second barrier or ghost is at least decent.

The only class that primarily uses AP are mages and tanks, and of that class, only mages actually build damage. Meanwhile fighters, most assassins, ADCs, skirmishers, Juggernauts, etc. It helps that since mages are ability based, a lot of their runes can be more flexible and multi-class, while the amount of champions that are auto-attack based are much smaller and more niche so those runes look more specialized. 

Footnote: Yes I know there are other champions that are not mages who build AP, but these champions are exceptions. In these cases, changes should be made to the champions, instead of adding new runes items to accomidate for an incredibly niche set of champs.

Mages and AP in general are much less diverse than AD as a whole.
AD has melee carries, marksmen, juggernauts, divers and assassins, aswell as other niche odd picks like GP.

AP has mages (with subclasses granted but every class has little subclasses aswell) and assassins.

Big difference, you cant make a new keystone for each different mage playstyle.
